intro: Amaryllis × amoena, commonly known as the hybrid amaryllis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a hybrid between Amaryllis belladonna and Amaryllis papifera, resulting in a plant with striking, showy flowers. The plant produces large, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of red, pink, white, and orange, often with contrasting stripes or spots. It is native to South America and thrives in warm, sunny conditions with well-draining soil. This hybrid is popular as a cultivated ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
